reviews.review: My cancer cells died after I watched this, because cancer cells got cancer.
I went to this movie high, and i didn't even enjoy it.
Very high quality and original film

The Emoji Movie was pretty much just as bad as I thought it would be, the movie had an idea that was prtetty much a terrible remake of Wreck It Ralph. Although, despite the terrible puns, the concept was interesting - it would have been simple to make a much better movie, but it had the same kind of charm that The Room does. I would advise seeing it for free, but not to see it in theatres or buy a copy. Although The Emoji Movie is catered towards children it doesn't that very well. Lastly, the funniest and classiest jokes were about the poop emoji, and were actually an entertaining feature. In my opinion The Emoji Movie was a decent movie at best and definitely deserved all the "Shit-Posting" it was given during the creation.
This was the most amazing movie I have ever seen.
Bad movie with bad characters and an even worse plot.

If I could give this movie 6 1/2 stars I would. Let me just start by saying the plot line was impeccable. The twists and turns that occur within the story exceeded my expectations. Maybe even more than The Blindside. Without a doubt I would see this again. It was totally worth the $15 to see it. Each punchline, especially the ones involving punny humor ?, were received by the crowd with abounding laughter. Jacksfilms and the actors chosen for the parts did a spectacular job at grasping each and every emoji's personality. Even down to the amazing princess/ Jailbreak!! I would just like to thank this generation for creating a world in which we have the freedom to express ourselves in this way with emojis, and a HUGE thank you to the production of this movie to prove that. This movie really has set a great example for the younger generations and it has helped me put my faith back in humanity. Thank you.

This is the worst movie that you will ever see in your entire life
It has the same plot every stereotypical Disney movie ever created. 
He wants to fit in, he makes a mistake and he goes on an adventure with a girl and a "funny" companion. They make up in a final battle and a big stupid dance party to a horrible 5 year old pop song.
The budget for this movie was $50000000. We could have built a homeless shelter in every state, but no, we had to have an emoji movie just to suit the gross, brain-washed children to get a chuckle out of and you waste $30.

And the cherry on top, they canceled the Popeye movie for this huge pile of garbage.

Better than I expected it would be, though it was still extremely cringy. It was a bit funny, but about half of the times I was laughing because of how stupid it was. I would probably watch it again just because of how stupidly funny it was.
